availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Native of Ireland. Married to Elizabeth Whitney Wylie in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on August 5, 1819. Father of John J. Wylie, Josiah W. Wylie, James S. Wylie, William K. Wylie, and David H. Wylie. Resient in Caldwell County in 1830. Owned two enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1830. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Died in Caldwell County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 141.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 356B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 783.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 49.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 220B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Caldwell County Administrators Bonds, July 6, 1862, p. 212A-B.
